column1: 25037,Senior Lecturer.1012223,Senior Lecturer.1012223,,Professional,true,KU External Portal,External,,Sourcing,Open,Posted,1012223,,,,,,,"

column9: >Khalifa University is a leading academic institution dedicated to providing world-class education, research, and innovation. The Department of Chemistry within the College of Engineering and Physical Sciences at Khalifa University invites applications
column14: mso-ansi-language: #4C09
column16: >for a Senior Lecturer position in Chemistry. Candidates should possess a Master&rsquo
column17: s degree in Chemistry, or a closely related discipline, from an accredited institution with a strong background in Chemistry.

column10: >The primary responsibility of this role is to deliver an exceptional teaching experience to our undergraduate students within the Chemistry Department, in the subject areas allocated to them, and perform instruction-related duties and responsibilities in a timely manner and in accordance with the mission, policies, and procedures of Khalifa University.
column14: mso-themecolor: text1

column10: >The responsibilities of the Senior Lecturer shall be an appropriate combination of:&nbsp
column14: color: black

column10: >a) Dissemination of knowledge through undergraduate and/or graduate teaching
column14: color: black

column11: b) University and community service
column14: color: black

column10: >Successful candidates are expected to teach the undergraduate courses as required, bringing not just expertise but also enthusiasm and innovation to the classroom.
column14: mso-themecolor: text1

column10: >The position demands candidates with a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience, with a strong preference for those who have gained education from and/or served in distinguished higher education institutions. Preference will also be given to applicants who have demonstrated a passion for teaching and have experience in inspiring and engaging students. This evidence should be seen in the candidate's past roles and teaching philosophy.
column14: mso-themecolor: text1

column1: <table class=""MsoNormalTable"" border=""1"" cellspacing=""0"" cellpadding=""0"" width=""0"" style=""width: 461.1pt

column14: Responsibilities
Teach at undergraduate level in subject areas and on time schedules allocated by the Department Chair
Prepare teaching material including course outline, syllabus and lesson plans. Revise the subject matter on a regular basis as appropriate for that subject
Contribute to the development, planning and implementation of a high quality curriculum
Provide students with detailed syllabus, methods of instruction and evaluation in their courses
Engage in the selection of textbooks and other teaching aids necessary to the instruction of courses
Monitor students&rsquo
column15: performance in their subject areas and provide remedial classes when necessary

column14: Set and mark exams, coursework, assignments, laboratory work, homework, and any other relevant activity
Use up-to-date instructional technology and ensure the delivery is clear and consistent
Supervise teaching internships
Develop and improve their scholarly competence and effectiveness as teachers within the area of expertise
Serve in a collegial fashion and in accordance to the University&rsquo
column15: s policies when dealing with other faculty members, students, administrators and members of the public

column14: Carry out any other duties commensurate with the position
Contribute to departmental, or University-wide working groups or committees as requested
Contribute to student recruitment, retention and placement efforts
Foster service by contributing to the community at large in participatory, developmental or advisory capacity
Support and participate in student organization activities
Adhere to the University's information security and confidentiality policies and procedures, and report breaches or other security risks accordingly
Coordinate with other departments to facilitate the accomplishment of tasks and responsibilities, as and when needed
Engage in outreach, collaboration, and public engagement activities.
Perform any other tasks assigned by the Line Manager

column2: >Attend workshops, seminars , and training sessions to enhance teaching methodologies and subject knowledge.

column8: s degree in related discipline from a recognized institution

column7: >A minimum of 8 years of experience relevant to the position
